decks.notes: The deck focuses on rapidly deploying Artifact creatures and utilizing artifacts to create explosive finishers. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of quick creatures, removal, and disruption spells, while also leveraging the power of artifact synergy. The key strategy is to use cards like Urza's Saga, Mox Opal, and Arcbound Ravager to generate advantage on the battlefield, while also having access to powerful artifact removal and disruption spells like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke to control the game.

The main concept of this deck involves using a combination of spells and creatures to quickly ramp up and deal damage to the opponent without relying on traditional land cards. By utilizing various counterspells and artifact cards like Goblin Charbelcher, the deck aims to efficiently control the game and secure a win through a unique landless combo strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Tameshi, Reality Architect and Thundertrap Trainer add versatility and surprise elements to keep the opponent off-guard and maintain board advantage.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly flood the board with cheap artifact creatures and use cards like Thoughtcast and Weapons Manufacturing to generate card advantage and deal quick damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes artifacts like Mox Opal and Engineered Explosives to ramp up and control the board, while also using cards like Tormod's Crypt to disrupt graveyard strategies. The inclusion of cards like Arcbound Ravager and Pinnacle Emissary provide additional versatility and resilience to the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with various abilities to create a toolbox of options for combos and utilities. It includes cards like Green Sun's Zenith to search for specific creatures, Agatha's Soul Cauldron for graveyard recursion, and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician for card advantage and removal. By carefully selecting and playing creatures like Badgermole Cub and Endurance, the deck aims to control the board while setting up powerful combos such as using Walking Ballista for direct damage or Grist, the Hunger Tide for token generation.

The deck focuses on using artifact creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. It utilizes cards that generate mana quickly, such as Mox Opal and Mox Amber, to power out threats like Cori-Steel Cutter and Emry, Lurker of the Loch early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Metallic Rebuke and Unholy Heat to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board. Additionally, cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga provide card advantage and help to find key pieces of the deck.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with taxing effects. It utilizes creatures like Solitude and Phlage to pressure the opponent, while using disruptive cards like Phelia and Quantum Riddler to slow down the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Ephemerate and Galvanic Discharge for removal and tempo plays. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive elements, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in order to seize victory.

The main concept of this deck is to fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, then bring them back onto the battlefield quickly with reanimation spells like Persist and Unearth. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Abhorrent Oculus and Psychic Frog to control the opponent's board while setting up the combo. By combining graveyard recursion with control elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration for card advantage. It includes a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to clear the way for attackers and finish off opponents. The addition of cards like Violent Urge and Slickshot Show-Off adds flexibility and additional reach to close out games quickly. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo through card selection and efficient removal spells.

This Boros Aggro deck revolves around quickly deploying low-cost, aggressive creatures and using burn spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a fast tempo, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to generate card advantage while dealing damage. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide additional reach and removal options, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory offer powerful late-game threats. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive strategies and efficient aggression to overwhelm opponents.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and spells while also disrupting their game plan with efficient removal and disruption cards. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent and control the board with threats like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm helps to keep the opponent on the back foot while also providing additional reach and versatility to close out games.

This deck focuses on using creatures as a toolbox to generate value and control the board. By tutoring for specific creatures with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Spymaster's Vault, the deck is able to assemble combo pieces like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Walking Ballista to disrupt opponents and close out the game. Cards like Malevolent Rumble and Delighted Halfling provide additional synergy and utility, while cards like Endurance and Grist, the Hunger Tide offer graveyard recursion and alternate win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by leveraging its versatile creature toolbox.

The deck focuses on quickly playing cheap artifacts and utilizing cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt to control the opponent's board while maintaining card advantage through Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Salvage Titan provide recursion options for key artifacts, while Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary serve as strong finishers. The deck utilizes the Affinity mechanic to reduce the cost of artifacts and aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, artifact ramp, and powerful combo pieces to quickly assemble and activate Goblin Charbelcher to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck includes a variety of ways to counter or disrupt the opponent's plays while drawing through the deck for key combo pieces. Key cards such as Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention help accelerate the combo, while additional support cards like Sea Gate Restoration and Tameshi, Reality Architect provide card advantage and utility. The deck aims to win the game quickly and efficiently without relying on traditional lands for mana production.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude to reanimate them for explosive plays. It also relies on disruption through counterspells like Force of Negation and tempo control with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and instant-speed plays, utilizing the graveyard as a resource for advantage.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board. The deck also utilizes cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Violent Urge to maintain pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a low mana curve and efficient card selection from cards like Preordain and Mishra's Bauble, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure and finish the game swiftly.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to maintain a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes cheap instant spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck aims to outpace the opponent and maintain pressure through a combination of direct damage and creature aggression. Additionally, cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration are used for card selection and advantage to keep the momentum going.
